column1: nice start. 139 kph, good length delivery on off, the ball seaming away. Warner can only defend. Keep six there.
a tad wider this time. Good length outside off, some movement. Away swing. Warner wafts and the ball goes past. Warner has had his problems against Boult, the ball moving away.
lovely stuff from Amir. Nice and full on off, inviting the ball to swing. Warner defends to mid-off
143 kph, another defensive nudge into the off side towards point
the first wayward one of the day. Back of a length down leg, Warner leaves. A wide called
141 kph good length outside off, prodded into the off side. Good lines these
143 kph, pushed towards cover off the good length. A nice gentle push. Lovely start from Amir
not nice. A low full toss to start, drilled to cover
another naughty full toss on off, driven down towards mid-off for a quick run. Hafeez hasn't done too much bowling in the recent past
nice. Flat on off, no turn. Warner goes back, chops the ball towards point
darted in on leg, Warner gets forward to defend. Nice length
Warner comes down and squeezes a drive towards extra cover. Warner made that into a full toss with his feet
pushed back to the bowler. A tidy start
142 kph, good length delivery moving away, a thick outside skew races down to third man. Just one
145 kph, good length on middle, inside-edged towards square leg. Warner still on 0
there is Warner's first. Full delivery, straight, a thick inside edge down to fine leg. Nice length this from Amir, seeing if the ball will swing
dabbed down to third man with an angled bat. Not much movement of the feet
jaffa. Takes something similar to beat Warner. Good length on off, the ball swerves away and beats the outside edge. Warner's feet were rooted in the crease

another one. 144 kph. Superb bowling. Warner had enough, stayed in the crease and attempted a leaden-footed uppish drive but there is some swing, the ball pitches and moves away to beat the outside edge again.
flat and wide outside off, hit hard to extra cover
slow through the air, a bit of loop an drift. Pushed back
this is a tad too full and Head smashes an on-drive to long-on
goes over midwicket this time for the first boundary of the day. Runs down to the pitch and shovels a flick over midwicket. Safe once he got to the pitch
too straight, flicked down to fine leg
flight on off, pushed to mid-off
141 kph, fullish delivery outside off, driven through cover for one
143 kph, on the pads, Head gets on his toes and flicks down to fine leg for a run

what a delivery! He has been doing it all afternoon. Superb bowling. Amir pushes this one fuller and straighter. Warner sees something on middle and chooses to flick into the leg side but is undone by substantial away swing. The ball beats the flick by some distance and clips the top of the bails. Wow, he wasn't close to that. Not a great shot.

edged and gone! Another peach from Amir. Fantastic captaincy from Azhar, after all the flak he's received. Bowls it full and wide. Asks Smith to drive through the vacant cover region. Smith can't say no with his form, can he? His feet are rooted in the crease, his drive is away from his body. The ball holds its line outside off and takes the edge. A routine catch for Rizwan.
nicely bowled from Amir. Full and straight, some inswing. Lynn flicks to square leg
145 kph, outside off on a length, well left by Lynn
good length on off, driven towards mid-off for one
good length outside off, 138 kph, driven through cover for one. Loud cheers from his home crowd
137 kph, strays down leg, a run down to fine leg
creamed through cover. Full and wide from Hasan. Lynn thrashes his drive to cover who half-stops the ball. Parried away towards the deep cover boundary. Azhar chases it down, but four runs are run
bouncer on off, too short. Lynn gets underneath. Wide called
nice. A good length on off, pushed away towards mid-off
big appeal! No says the umpire. Good length delivery around off, the ball nips back in and cuts Lynn in half. A noise, probably off the thigh pad, on its way to the keeper.
full and straight from Amir, Head is hanging on the back foot but is able to defend
good length outside off, 146 kph, driven towards cover from the back foot

143 kph, good call from Lynn. Back of a length delivery outside off, the ball swerves back in. A thick inside edge into the pad, towards short leg. Lynn calls Head through even though the batsman has no idea where the ball has gone
through cover. Good length outside off, Lynn stays in the crease and punches through cover for three. Nicely executed
144 kph, good length a tad wide outside off, cut away towards point
nice end. 142 kph, fullish on off, blocked back
smashed. Back of a length from Hasan Ali and Lynn BBL's the ball way into the stands. A heave waaaaay over midwicket. Just so easy for Lynn
back of a length outside off, pushed away towards cover for one
140 kph, fullish on off, driven towards cover for a couple more
137 kph, full and straight, driven to mid-on. No swing for Hasan Ali
on the pads, poor bowling this. Flicked through midwicket. Such a long boundary that four runs are run with time to spare
135 kph, fullish delivery around off, driven to cover from the crease
digs one in on off, so high that it loops over Lynn. Don't have to be so short at the Gabba. A back of a length is ideal here
143 kph, better, more like it. Back of a length on middle and leg, swatted to deep square leg for one. Hustled Lynn for pace
poor bowling. Short and wide outside off, Head stays back and drills a back-foot punch through cover. Easily hit
short and wide this time, rubbish. Head stands tall and scythes a cut through point this time. Four more.
oh my, Wahab helping Australia out with a buffet of help-yourself deliveries. I wouldn't mind this. Short and wide again, Head crashes a cut through point for four more.
141 kph, punched towards point. Slightly closer to off.
decent end to a quite terrible over. On a length outside off, pushed into the off side
136 kph, on a length around off, pushed back to the bowler

that isn't a great shot and Lynn falls. Another BBL stroke. Slower delivery this time, full and wide. Lynn just chooses the wrong shot. Premeditated. Could have clattered that over the off side, but he got down on one knee and slog-swept a drag-flick straight into the air. Rizwan runs around, doesn't look to comfortable underneath the skier but importantly, takes the catch. Had to drag that from too wide.
full and wide from Hasan. Tripe. Drilled through cover. All timing, lots of power too.
full and wide again. Tear-your-hair-out bowling. Head leans on this and finds the gap through cover for four more. This time from around the wicket.
much much better. Full and straight, 139 kph, Head defends
fullish, better line, sixth-stump line outside off. A thick outside edge down to third man
shortish and a tad wide, no spin. Played to point from the back foot
ooh, flat and wide outside off, no turn. Marsh is still beaten on the outside edge
flat and straight, Marsh goes back to defend
nice and straight, full, pushed back to the bowler
too straight, some flight, driven towards midwicket
good over that. Flat and wide outside off, chopped towards cover
shortish and wide, Head goes right back and slaps the ball to long-off from the back foot
a tad slow on off and middle, punched to long-on from the back foot
slow through the air outside off, pushed to point. Better length from Hafeez
too full this time, pushed back to the bowler
shortish around off, punched out towards cover
drilled to long-off from the crease
flat and wide from Wasim, cut towards short third man
beaten on the outside edge. Skids on with the arm, wide outside off. Head misses his waft
flat and straight, no spin. Skewed off the outside half towards deep point
flat on the pads, Marsh misses his flick, struck on the thigh pad
driven to long-off for one, 102 kph

edged and gone. Wasim strikes. Pakistan chipping away. Head looked all at sea against the non-turning spin of Wasim. A flat delivery outside off, skids on with the arm again. Head looks to slap a drive through cover but plays inside the line, like he has been doing against Wasim. The ball kisses the outside edge and settles in Rizwan's gloves. Good catch too
flat on middle, pushed out to long-on. An easy single, why give him one there?
worked towards midwicket
short and wide, that's a poor ball. Cut through cover for a couple from the back foot
ooh, Maxwell plays for some spin, not much there, a leading edge back to the bowler
worked towards square leg
nice bowling, Slow through the air, some flight outside off, defended. 'Jaldi karo,' (hurry up) screams Riwan. Not a bad tactic that, get through overs without these two noticing
91 kph, pushed away towards midwicket. Another dot
well bowled, slow through the air, some flight, spin too. Defended towards point
quick on leg, pushed to a straight midwicket
slow again through the air outside off, pushed to long-off. A bit in the air
short on middle, punched to long-on
flat on off and middle, played back
offcutter on off, played into the leg side
144 kph, another terrible delivery from Wahab. Short and wide, scythed behind point for four. This isn't good bowling
much better. Good length on a fifth-stump line. The ball deviates past the bat
too straight this time, nudged down to fine leg
well left. On a length outside off, left alone. Rizwan fails to collect cleanly, almost hits the helmet positioned behind him
fullish outside off, defended into the off side, and drinks
length ball angling into middle and off, no turn. Maxwell shows the full face to push to long-on
this time there is some turn, and Marsh nicks off! That excellent length again, never quite up there to drive, on off stump. Marsh chances the drive, and only manages a thin edge through to Rizwan
slated across, and Wade gets across, gets down low, and lap-sweeps from just outside off, into the short fine-leg region
fullish on leg stump, clipped through square leg
sweeps again, against the angle. It's a bit of a risk given the drift Imad gets away from the left-hander, but Wade manages to play it safely enough into the fine leg region
fired in flat on the stumps, Maxwell shows the full face to defend to midwicket
shortish outside off, Wade lets it come on and dabs down to third man
length ball angling away from off stump, Maxwell gets across to push into the covers
bouncer, off-target, ends up angling it a fair way down the leg side
back of a length close to off stump, defended with an open face towards point
length ball, and was that a tiny bit of inward swerve towards middle stump, maybe some seriously early reverse? No worries for Wade just yet, lets it come on and clips quietly through midwicket
shortish on off stump, defended towards point
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
length ball swerving in towards off stump, check-driven to long-off
fullish, angling away from off stump, gets nicely forward to block it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched to short extra-cover

back of a length, a little closer to off stump, shuffles across and tucks it into the leg side for a risky single. Direct hit would have had Maxwell at the striker's end, but Akmal, moving to his left from midwicket, can't hit the stumps
back of a length on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
floated up slow on middle and off, stretches out and rolls his wrists over to play that watchfully to mid-on. Another excellent over from Imad
back of a length close to off stump, gets back and across to defend back to the bowler
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Shuffles across to work it wide of mid-on
short on middle and off, gets across and whips it away through backward square leg
very full, again a hint of possible reverse into the left-hander, towards off stump. Wade clips it away through midwicket
straighter now, on leg stump, flicked to long leg
fullish outside off, driven to deep point
flighted outside off, Maxwell reaches out and drives with an open face, in the air for a while but into the gap to the left of short extra-cover
full again, drifting across the left-hander, who stretches out to block into the covers
a bit quicker, punched off the front foot to short extra
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to work it through square leg
down the track skips Maxwell, Imad fires it quicker, punched back to the bowler
down the track again, and again Imad bowls flatter but along a straighter line. Maxwell clips neatly through midwicket

back of a length, a bit of inward movement, and Wade is given out lbw! He's reviewed this immediately, convinced he's inside-edged it. He has. Poor shot from Wade, feet rooted to the crease and he looks to drive on the up, down the ground. Ball nips in off the seam and hits back pad, off the inside edge
shortish outside off, Wade goes deep in his crease and stabs to backward point
full, fairly wide outside off. Wade goes after it without moving his feet too much, edges it thickly, but it's well wide of slip and races away to the third man boundary
length ball angling into off stump, Wade steps across and clips to midwicket
fullish on off stump, whipped to deep backward square leg
loses his line with the change of strike. This would have been a perfect off-stump ball to Wade. Maxwell clips it off his pad to the left of deep square leg
fullish on off stump, clipped against the angle to midwicket
back of a length, angling across the left-hander, who shuffles across and flicks from outside off to midwicket
fuller, on off stump now, Wade clips through backward square leg
down the track and that's smartly bowled. Slows it down a bit, pulls the length back, and Maxwell has to defend into the covers, with the turn
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
fired in flat, back of a length, angling into off stump. Blocked back to the bowler

tossed up outside off, and that's lovely from Maxwell, full extension of the arms to lift that gently over the covers, finds the gap to the right of the sweeper. He's batting with a cap on now, made that shot look even better
length ball outside off, Maxwell opens his bat face to drive to point
down the track now, and that's a nice bit of old-fashioned ODI batting. Nawaz fired it into his pads, and he whipped it in the air, but checked his shot, to hit it on the bounce to long-on
good ball, a bit of loop and dip outside off. Wade stretches out to defend, gets an inside-edge that rolls to short fine leg
chips down the track now, gets close to the pitch and flicks to deep midwicket
quickish, back of a length, angling into off stump. Maxwell goes on the back foot and whips it wristily back to the bowler
quickish length ball outside off, stretches out and defends into the covers
flat, back of a length, angling into off stump. Goes back and across to work into the leg side. Hasan Ali takes his eye off the ball while sliding to his left from midwicket to field it
shot! Fired in on a good length, and Maxwell uses the angle adroitly, gets forward and uses his bottom wrist brilliantly to shovel-sweep from outside off, into the long leg region
length ball angling into the stumps, gets on the front foot and works it to the left of deep square leg
down the track now, Imad shortens his length outside off. Maxwell pushes with a straight bat to mid-on
a bit of flight on off stump, and Maxwell absolutely smashes that. A slap-sweep with a roll of the wrists to drill that to the midwicket boundary

again looks to work a ball from outside off to fine leg. Turns more than he expects as he comes on the front foot and it goes past his inside edge and hits front pad. Not too much of an appeal, that was probably headed down leg
down the track now, clips with the turn to long-on
length ball outside off, presses forward to defend into the covers

shot. This is glorious from Maxwell. Third man and backward point were both in the circle, Nawaz gave him the perfect line, floated up outside off, and those quick hands are through the ball in a blur to reverse-sweep between the two fielders
down the track now, and that's lovely. A checked chip, on the bounce, to long-on, played with the full face of the bat showing
there's that Wade trademark again. Stretches out to a length ball pitching outside off and rolls his wrists over to play it to short fine leg. Wanted a single, and Maxwell, rightly, sent him back
back of a length on middle and off, whipped through square leg
back of a length on middle stump, tucked down to long leg
short ball over off stump, pulled to deep square leg

back of a length on leg stump, worked through backward square leg. They chance a second, throw is at the bowler's end, and make it fairly easily. Would have been interesting had Wahab's throw been closer to the bowler
fullish on off stump, driven back to the bowler
length ball outside off, driven to short cover

flat, angling into leg stump, Maxwell goes for the reverse-sweep again. He's working against the angle, but he's not bothered, those wrists do all the work to hit it in the air to the backward point boundary
length ball on middle and off, Maxwell gets on the front foot to defend back down the pitch

oh my, nearly gets himself out in bizarre fashion. Goes for that chip-drive to the flighted ball outside off. Great spot from Ian Chappell on TV commentary. Saw that Maxwell's bat had hit his front pad before meeting bat, changing its course slightly. May have wanted to drive that ball over the covers, instead ends up hitting towards long-off sprinting in from the rope. Dives forward desperately but can't reach the ball in time to catch it
flat on middle stump, clipped through midwicket
down the track now, clips into the midwicket region
once again, Wade works a ball off the stumps into the leg side
short on off stump, pulls to deep square leg and brings up a superb half-century, full of craft and innovation
short outside off, looks for the horizontal-bat slap, the ball hits the outside half of the bat and runs down to third man
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
back of a length on middle stump, worked to the left of midwicket
length ball close to off stump, looks to drive through mid-off, maybe, doesn't time it and it ends up going slowly to the left of short cover. Another easily taken quick single
shortish on middle stump, maybe not short enough to pull. Wade is a little late on the shot and the ball hits his stomach

I don't know if he meant that. Short ball, angling away from off stump. Maxwell was leaving that, I think, and the ball ended up hitting the middle of his bat as he pulls it back behind him and running down to third man

back of a length outside off, dabbed down to the right of backward point. I think they picked the right fielder to chance another quick single against. It was Imad Wasim, and he's left-handed, and he fumbled as he tried to pick up and transfer hands
short on off stump, rises on his toes to defend into the off side
short down leg, Maxwell misses his pull and it's given wide. Pakistan appeal for a caught behind. Replays confirm there was no bat anywhere near the ball
short on leg stump, pulled to the right of deep square leg
beaten. Goes on the back foot to slash that through point, but it probably wasn't short enough, and he ended up going with a diagonal bat
short slower ball outside off, Wade lets it come on and squeezes it to backward point, rolling his wrists over at the top of the bounce
good ball, length ball angling into middle and off. Maxwell wanted some room to flay that through the covers. Had to check his shot in the end while playing it to short extra
bouncer outside off, maybe the slower bouncer. Maxwell wanted to pull, but it rises too high for that and he aborts his shot
short outside off, this time it rises to the perfect height to pull, just around chest height, and he puts it away between midwicket and mid-on

back-of-a-length slower ball, looks like the offcutter, comes in a little bit and cramps Maxwell as he skips away from the line to hit through the off side. Ends up having to play that to midwicket instead
length ball on off stump, punched to short extra
short ball on off stump, this one is dug in with more venom, bounces steeply, and Maxwell has to pull it from over his right shoulder. Ends up top-edging very fine, to the left of third man

gone! Hasan Ali has varied his pace beautifully in this over, and he does Maxwell with another little offcutter. Looks to flick it over midwicket, is through his shot too early, and it loops up off the high part of his bat and midwicket takes the simplest of catches
a fullish length outside off, dabbed towards backward point
slower delivery outside off, a deft dab towards backward point with an angled bat. Played well
full and wide outside off, Faulkner gets forward and leaves
on a length and straight, blocked back
full outside off, 134 kph, left alone. Good batting, no reason to play exuberantly so early
fullish around off, Faulkner gets forward and across, and works through midwicket for a couple
flat and straight, nudged to backward square leg
slow but strays down leg for an extra, wide called
flat and quick on leg, worked to deep midwicket
too full from Hafeez, on leg stump, pushed to long-on
flat on off, better line, played to midwicket
on the pads, nudged away towards square leg
flicked down to long-on for one. Australia played that over well, five riskless runs
slow on off, some loop, defended to cover
91 kph, worked towards backward square leg from the back foot. Clever from Faulkner
Wade runs down but Nawaz shortens the length, improvised nudge to midwicket
gets down closer to the pitch to flick to deep midwicket
nice. Flat on off, blocked into the off side

90 kph, edged and gone. Faulkner falls. Pakistan strike again. Good captaincy to have the slip in place and Faulkner edges behind. A lovely length, shortish but close to off, Extracts a bit if turn, Faulkner plays away from his body and gets a thick outside edge which is well held by Hafeez at first slip, to his left. That came quickly.
slow through the air, outside off, driven to cover
83 kph, gets down to the pitch of the ball and drive to long-on
short and slow on off, pushed away to long-on
flat outside off, Wade checks his stroke and bunts the ball to long-off. Uppish
83 kph, flat outside off, defended back
84 kph, flat down leg, nudged into the leg side
87 kph, driven up to long-on with the spin
flat outside off, a hint of turn, pushed to cover
slow and straight, well bowled. Cummins is through his shot, drive back to the bowler
hit back to the bowler again, a tad too full this time
slow outside off, Cummins uses the full face to drive back
gets this one a tad wide outside off so easier for Cummins to knock the ball in the gap to long-off
slow and straight, easily worked with the spin to long-on
a bit of spin, slow on off, played into the leg side
Wade gets down and defends, Hafeez intentionally bowled that wider outside off
gets down and clips to midwicket for one, called for one immediately
flat on off, worked to midwicket
nudged to square leg, another dot
Wade shimmies down to the pitch to flick to deep midwicket
a tad too full on off, driven with the spin to long-off
advances to the pitch and works to long-on with the spin. Good batting from Wade, knows there isn't big spin
flat outside off, some spin, played back
lovely bowling. Slow through the air, pitches on middle, turns to off. Cummins is squared up but edges a couple towards third man
pushed out to long-off
yorks Cummins, played back, jammed out
flat down leg, Cummins is rapped on the pads but the ball pings off towards third man for a leg bye
flat and quick outside off, Wade gets on top of the bounce to work one through square leg
flat down leg, a thick inside squeeze down to fine leg off the inside edge
darted in outside off, nicely clipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
he gets that through but don't mind that. Flat and wide, driven through cover for a couple
lovely shot. Steps out to get close to the pitch, gets there and flicks over midwicket for a couple to long-on
played down to fine leg. Excellent fielding, quick to ensure there's no one
flicked off the straight line to deep backward square leg
slow through the air and straight, played back
edged and dropped this time. Should have been taken. Flat and wide, Cummins gets a thick outside edge which hits Hafeez on the right leg. Burst through, did he even get a hand on it?
pushed to long-off with the spin
flat and quick outside off, driven to long-off
whoa. Almost takes out Cummins. Flat and wide, drilled to long-off
slow through the air on off, pushed back to the bowler
flat and quick on off, driven to the bowler
slow through the air, drifts down leg. Cummins has the whole leg side open but picks out midwicket
nice end. Flat and quick on leg, played back
gets to the pitch, Nawaz fires it wide outside off. Wade still goes through with a nice clean swing and lofts the ball just past long-on for six. Fifty for Wade, a lovely fighting knock
nice. So much control. Gets to the pitch and flicks over midwicket for a couple. Nice batting
a flick through square leg for a couple more. Superb batting
swept powerfully but straight to deep backward square leg
slapped to long-off from the crease
swept away to deep midwicket for another run
back of a length, 131 kph, short. Wade gets on top of the bounce and nails his pull to deep square leg
slower delivery on off, 129 kph, dabbed towards backward point
nicely played. Back of a length on off, swatted to deep midwicket for two
good length outside off, Cummins slashes and misses. Beaten by the bounce
bouncer down leg, tennis-ball bouncer down leg, wide called

run-out! A total breakdown in communication. Cummins dabbed to point, called yes and stopped. Wade responded to Cummins' initial call and kept going. Akmal picked up cleanly at point and threw the ball back to Amir, who had returned to the stumps to collect the ball. He takes off the bails and Cummins is well short. A good piece of fielding.
on the pads, worked down to fine leg
a slow high full toss outside off. The legcutter gone wrong. Wade completely surprised, tries a dab to third man but misses
fantastic execution. Gave himself room, then got right across to scoop the ball through fine leg for four. Got a good length delivery outside off
142 kph, dabbed towards backward point
145 kph, worked to backward point again. Screams 'no run, in exasperation and frustration
good bouncer. Directed at the badge, Wade gets a thick top edge which flies down to the fine leg boundary
short, slow legcutter outside off, swatted down to deep square leg for one
he tries. But dishes out one full and straight that is pushed to long-on for a run
145 kph, just short of midwicket. A good length delivery on middle and leg, Starc gets a leading edge towards midwicket. Amir is not happy
pushed to mid-off for one
a low full toss outside off, driven to mid-off
132 kph, on a length down leg, flicked down to deep fine leg for one. A whip off the hips

what was the fielder doing? That was awful fielding. Back of a length on middle and leg, Starc pulls and gets enough to clear the boundary. Sharjeel was a few metres inside the field, trotted back, and watched the ball go over his head. Gave up on it soooo early. He could have got back and easily taken the catch inside the field of play. A costly error
a yorker on off, jammed back to the bowler who leaps and parries to mid-on
a low full toss on off, driven to long-on
134 kph, full on off, Wade wanted to go straight but skewed the ball towards midwicket. Hafeez dives to his right to prevent additional runs
a nice slower ball, Starc is way too early through his stroke. Just over the stumps

cleans 'im up. An offcutter that doesn't cut. Full and straight from Hasan Ali. Starc is nowhere near the ball as he misses his flick. The zing bails fly everywhere. Excellent bowling, totally deceived him with a change-down in pace
full delivery outside off, Stanlake just misses the ball. Beaten on the outside edge
a low full toss on leg, 138 kph. Hits the ball back to the bowler via a deflection off the pad
145 kph, full outside off, pushed to mid-off. No run, the fielder is quick on it
Wade gives himself plenty of room, Amir follows him, popped towards mid-off for one
full and straight, hit down towards mid-on. The fielder dives to his right to save three. Good effort. Stanlake's first international runs
huuuuuuge! A slower ball on leg, Wade gets forward and swings high and deep over midwicket. A long boundary, clears it comfortably
out with a direct hit. Full delivery outside off, pushed towards short cover. Amir under-arms his flick to the keeper. Stanlake's bat jars in the turf too
excellent bowling. Well played too. Yorker on off, jammed away towards gully
full and straight from Hasan, Wade gets underneath the length and heaves over midwicket. Long-on can't get across
a nice slower bouncer. Wade dances down but misses his heave. Beaten for pace. Nice change-down
four more. A yorker on off, a thick outside edge races down to the third man boundary. Wade moves to 85
slower delivery down leg, Wade top-edges his heave towards square leg. Lands in no-man's land
121 kph, on the pads, Stanlake misses his flick. Rapped on the pad
big appeal. Not out says the umpire. Looked like bat on pad, not ball. Pakistan review. A big noise but the ball missed bat by some distance. Full delivery outside off, Stanlake is beaten
a low full toss on middle, 140 kph, heaved to midwicket. Beaten by the length of that, spliced away
four more. Gets forward, converts a low full toss into a high full toss and swivels the ball through backward square leg for another boundary
140 kph, a short loopy bouncer outside off, a wide called
144 kph, another full toss on leg. Wade misses his heave. Struck on the pad. Sliding down
144 kph, another full toss down leg. Wade gets across and misses his scoop. Just misses leg stump. Good non-call from umpire Shamsuddin. That hit the leg stump actually, bails do not come off
shovelled to long-on for a couple. Stanlake races down for two.
142 kph, Wade gets across and nudged down to fine leg.
119 kph, slower short ball down leg. Wade misses his heave and is thwacked on the stomach. Youch!
full on middle and leg, Wade gives himself room and lofts the ball through cover for four more
slower delivery on middle, Wade is too early through his heave. Beaten
another short slow delivery down leg, Wade got forward, wanted to dab one through the leg side for two but can't make contact
he gets there. How did he make that? Short delivery on leg, pulled towards square leg. The keeper gets there but returns a bad throw off-balance. Hasan fumbles his collection. Onto 99

a leading edge to point and Wade gets hundred. Another slower ball on middle, Wade gets enough bat to get the run he required for his maiden ODI hundred. Screams in delight, the dressing room and the Gabba are all up. A fantastic knock this from Wade
back of a length outside off, left alone
full, a bit of swing in from outside off. Azhar drives crisply but straight to short extra-cover
length ball, goes wider outside off this time, no swing this time. Azhar leaves it alone
ooh, this one is fuller, threatens to swing in towards off stump but doesn't quite do as much as Azhar expects. Looks to drive through mid-off, gets a thick edge down to third man
drifts onto the pads, clipped to short fine leg
full, slanting down leg, doesn't bend back enough towards the stumps for Starc to make a confident lbw appeal as Sharjeel misses his flick

starts with a good ball, fourth-stump line, good length, away swing. Azhar leaves. He's a tall man with what seems a very side-on, slingy, Shoaib-esque release, without the humongous run-up and the wild hair and the crazy pace. A bit of a pause in his jump as well. So not really like Shoaib.
short and wide, Azhar misses out, doesn't go hard at the cut and fails to connect anyway
short and wide again, cut straight to backward point
back of a length outside off, left alone. Again a bit of outswing
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on, lets it swing and dabs to backward point
short, not as much width as those cuttable balls. Azhar waits on it and steers it to third man with a little wave of the wrists at the top of the bounce
nice length, slants across the batsman before shaping back in towards off stump. Azhar shows the full face and punches to mid-on
fullish, swings in a little towards off stump. Azhar slices his drive a little, between backward point and cover point
short ball, down the leg side, Azhar lifts his bat over his head and out of the way. Wade seems to cramp a little as he moves to his left to collect
beaten. Good length outside off, continues on with the angle across rather than swinging back in. Azhar fails to connect with the on-the-up drive
this time he holds his shape a little longer, and is in the perfect position to play a checked drive, on the up, between short extra-cover and mid-off

whoa, what happened there? That was short outside off, and Azhar shaped to cut, and the ball just leapt off the pitch, kept rising and rising, beat his bat by a foot, and continued to defy gravity even as Wade leaped behind the stumps
back of a length outside off, stabbed towards point
back of a length, leg-sideish. Sharjeel fails to connect with a flick off the hip, ball hits his body. Wade dives to his right to stop the ball from rolling away for leg byes
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
down the leg side again, Sharjeel misses another flick, but this one is wide enough to be called wide

shortish, not quite short enough to pull. Plus he didn't move his feet at all. Front leg just went up in a prance, and the ball was through him before he could bring his bat across it. Hits him on the body
oh man. Sharjeel defies the cliche of the subcontinental batsman who loves the ball on his pads. Misses another flick, and the ball hits his pad. Pitching well outside leg, of course
on the legs again, a bit shorter, this time he's managed to tuck it down to long leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched to mid-off. There's that super-straight Azhar Ali bat again
back of a length, and it nips in and cuts Sharjeel in half as he plays a leaden-footed push from the crease. He's saved by bounce. It didn't miss the top of middle stump by much.
length ball angling into middle stump, defended to mid-on
fuller now, on off stump, clipped in the air, with the angle, towards the midwicket boundary. Slows down considerably after landing
overpitched, a bit of width too, Sharjeel plays a checked drive to the right of mid-off. Didn't quite middle it, it seemed to hit the inside half of his bat
short outside off, not much width. Jumps to ride the bounce and chop it down to short cover
overpitched again, on off stump. Times this clip crisply, but it's close enough to mid-on for him to stop it with a dive to his left

Taken! But he's caught it beyond the boundary. That was a length ball, angling across towards off stump, and Sharjeel shovels that against the angle, up and over long leg, and Starc leaps backwards, over the rope, and takes an impressive but inconsequential one-handed catch
length ball on middle and off, clipped away through square leg
strays on the pads, Azhar flicks to the left of long leg

oh man. He's almost headed that to third man. Bouncer angling across him, rising to head high. Very awkward to evade. In the end he dropped his wrists and ducked his head while looking away, and it hits the top of the helmet and ricochets to third man. It's taken off the rim of one of the air inlets
short, rising ball angling in towards off stump. Azhar jumps to get on top of the bounce and keep his defensive shot down into the leg side
back of a length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
fullish on off stump, driven to mid-on
length ball, nips back in from outside off. Half stride forward to defend, adjusts to the movement and knocks it gently into the on side for a quick single
shortish, angling across Azhar. Waits on it and dabs it down to the left of backward point

looks like the slower ball outside off, gives Sharjeel the one thing he craves above everything else. Hitting room. Holds his shape nicely, keeps his head still, and hits that in the air, in the gap between mid-on and midwicket
length ball outside off, doesn't really get forward to drive, just throws his hands at it and fails to connect
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
shortish outside off, gets on his toes and defends towards point

back of a length on off stump, looks to use his wrists to work that through the leg side. Can't get it as square as he likes, because it bounces more than he expects, and he adjusts to play it down defensively into the midwicket region
short and very wide. Azhar can't connect as he reaches out and attempts a slash
full on middle and leg, drives with a straight bat to the left of midwicket. And becomes the latest player afflicted by the cramp epidemic as he turns to run a second. Hobbles it instead
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
short, not enough width to cut, Azhar has to play with an angled bat and it zips past his outside edge
back of a length close to off stump, punched back to the bowler

gone, gone. Full outside off, and Sharjeel has been struggling for timing right through this innings. Doesn't connect cleanly with his hit down the ground, gets neither the desired elevation nor placement, and he hits it straight to Maxwell at mid-on
length ball slanting away from off stump, Hafeez leaves
a bit wider now, Hafeez leaves again
back of a length outside off, punched pleasingly to the right of point
back of a length on middle and off, defended to mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the off side
fullish on off stump, punched back with the full face showing and Cummins fields in his follow-through, bending down quickly and stopping it with his right hand
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended to mid-on
bouncer over off stump, Azhar ducks but he doesn't need to. Rises well over head height
strays on to middle and leg and Hafeez plays a sweet little pick-up shot over square leg. Faulkner chases from long leg and puts in a despairing dive to stop it at the boundary
short, wide, and Babar puts it away, slapping it through cover point
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
full, close to off stump, that is excellent timing but his drive is a little too close to mid-off to get him any runs. Fielder only needed to move a couple of steps to his left

Whoops, not a great shot. Excellent length from Faulkner, inviting the drive without necessarily being driveable. Bowls it wide enough to entice Hafeez into the shot. Doesn't get his weight into it in time, is a little late getting fully forward, and only manages a thin edge
length ball angling away from off stump. Akmal comes forward to defend, gets a thick inside edge into his front pad
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot into the off side
back of a length close to off stump, punched to short cover
back of a length on middle stump, shuffles across to tuck it to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra
length ball outside off, steep bounce to the keeper after Babar leaves
full outside off, this time he gets just enough width to be able to place his checked drive in the gap between mid-off and extra-cover
back of a length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
short outside off, not enough width for an attacking shot. Jumps to ride the bounce and jabs to point
back of a length on off stump, dabs into the off side and calls for a single, but point runs in quickly to field it and Babar sends him back
back of a length, close to off stump, defended into the covers

shot! Length ball on off stump, and that is technical perfection. Gets a good stride forward, gets his left elbow high, shows the bowler the sticker on his bat, and sends it racing away past his dive to the left
back of a length on off stump, defended into the point region
full outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across and clips it through square leg
bam. Umar had faced nine dot balls, and he had had enough. Length ball on off stump, in the slot for him to clear his front leg and heave that down the ground, to the left of mid-on

shuffles across to this slower ball, misses the flick. Huuuuuge lbw appeal from Faulkner, not given. Looked like it pitched outside leg, but Australia have reviewed. Big shuffle from Akmal. Did that pitch in line? No bat on it, certainly. Pitching juuust outside leg
in the blockhole close to off stump, opens his bat face to jab it through backward point
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
length ball close to off stump, driven to the left of mid-off with a bottom-handed whip
bouncer, angling into the batsman and not getting up all that high. Babar does very well to duck quickly and duck low to get under it
back of a length close to off stump, plays nice and late to defend into the backward point region
shortish outside off, chopped to backward point
on a length just outside off, Akmal gets forward to defend
full and straight, tailing away late but Akmal manages an awkward defensive stroke
loose shot. Full and wide from Starc, probably there to play but Akmal moves his feet nowhere, throws his hands at that. A thick outside edge flies over gully
a slower ball at 123 kph outside off, pushed to mid-off
that's a nice stroke. A bouncer on middle and leg, Akmal plays his pull nicely, gets on top of the bounce and controls the shot through backward square leg for a couple
fullish delivery outside off, pushed towards mid-on
flight outside off, driven to mid-off
quick and flat on leg, defended into the leg side
just short of midwicket. A lazy stroke. Flight on leg, Azam gets forward and clips the ball towards midwicket
flat on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
flat on middle and leg, inside-edged towards square leg
uses his feet, gets there and drives past the bowler for a run to long-on
yikes. What waaaas thaaat? Full and wide outside off, Akmal runs at Starc and aims to send him into the long-on stands. Misses
147 kph, much better shot. Gets a low full toss on middle, worked through midwicket for four. Just a clip
poor line. On the pads, flicked down to fine leg for a run
pace off the ball, 128 kph, a thick outside-halved drive to third man for a run

gone! Akmal has played another terrible stroke. What was he trying to do? Clear mid-on with a pull? Poor choice of stroke. Back of a length from Starc outside off, hustles Akmal for pace. Akmal tries to forehand the ball into the leg side but may have been too late to the ball. Splices the ball straight to mid-on, who takes an easy catch. Ooh, actually that may have been the offcutter.
looking for the yorker, gets it wrong, low full toss driven to mid-on
87 kph, slow on off, solidly blocked
too full from Head outside off, flicked to long-on
88 kph outside off, driven to long-on
slow through the air, 87 kph, defended into the leg side
nice again, slow through the air and straight, defended
good end, 92 kph, flat on leg, worked into the leg side
full and wide outside off, a thick outside edge races down to third man
147 kph, good length delivery outside off, Babar wafts and is beaten. The ball climbs and climbs. Whew, exaggerated bounce
that's a poor ball though. Drifts down leg, nudged down to the fine leg boundary
143 kph, full delivery outside off, not much movement but mighty accurate. Goes past the edge
good length outside off, played into the leg side, towards point
fullish outside off, nicely pushed down towards mid-off
nice. Rizwan gets down and paddle-sweeps down to fine leg. A productive stroke for Rizwan
slow through the air on off, Rizwan inside-edges his skew into his pad
well bowled. Rizwan comes forward, head fires it down leg, off the pad towards fine leg
flat on off, worked through square leg
played to Smith at short midwicket
flat down leg, worked away down to Stanlake at deep backward square leg for a run
good length outside off, played towards backward point
128 kph, back of a length on off, Rizwan is on top of the bounce but plays towards short leg
short and wide, poor delivery. Rizwan unleashes a cut but doesn't make contact
excellent line. Tight around off, Rizwan does what he can to that, defends
full outside off, 134 kph, a thick outside edge down to third man for one
on the pads, flicked through square leg for one more
flat down leg, a simple nudge to fine leg gets Azam one
a wide almost turns into a wicket. Flat delivery down leg, Rizwan wanted to paddle sweep, but toe-ends it towards square leg. Lands in front of Maxwell
driven towards cover
nicely bowled, slow on off, some spin back in, Rizwan defends
a solid forward defensive shot. Another tidy over from Head, just one off it
good lines from Marsh. Rather close to off on a good length, defended into the off side
nice stroke. Overpitched on off, pushed away towards mid-on with the full face. This asking rate climbing quietly
well played. Back of a length on off, Azam gets on top of the bounce and pulls to deep square leg
138 kph, short down leg, pulled down to fine leg for a run.
full delivery outside off, skewed behind point for a couple. Nice, that's better from Pakistan
135 kph, on a length outside off, chopped towards the keeper on the bounce
flat down leg, 90 kph, paddled down to fine leg
Azam comes forward, Head fires it wider. Played towards third man
pushed back to the bowler
comes down to the pitch and badly mis-times his drive to mid-off. Too close to the pitch
flat on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
a fine paddle sweep to fine leg for a couple more. Four from it, a decent over for both sides
short and wide from Marsh, slapped through cover for a run
133 kph, full and wide, RIzwan misses his drive. May have been undone by some seam movement
nice. Good length delivery outside off, dabbed down to third man for one
another deft dab towards third man. Azam finding his range slowly
135 kph, nice finish from Marsh. Fullish delivery outside off, seaming back in. Strikes Rizwan on the pads but going well over the stumps
full and straight. 133 kph, a thick inside edge to deep square leg for one
lovely stroke, equally good fielding. Full outside off, Rizwan times his drive to cover, Lynn dives to his right to field
another dot, fullish outside off, pushed to mid-off
good length outside off, chopped into the ground and over slip for a run to third man. Not sure what he was trying to do there, ungainly
just past leg stump for a couple. Fullish on a fifth-stump line. Azam's waft results in a thick inside edge which misses the stumps

Azam was looking so good, then he does this. A stroke fraught with so much risk with a slip in place. Back of a length from Cummins, seaming back in. Azam tries to steer the ball to third man for one. The inward movement helps the ball rap the glove and just lob to Smith at slip. An easy catch. But well bowled too. Got some bounce and extra oomph in his delivery.
back of a length outside off, 145 kph. Wasim lets it go
shortish outside off, awkwardly played to point from the crease
on a length around off, played back to the bowler
shortish and wide, slashed down to third man for one
134 kph, around off on a length, defended back
full and wide, 134 kph, a toe-ended drive races down to third man
gets it through this time. Just two, wow. Should have been three there. Full and straight, Rizwan runs down at Marsh and shovels the ball through midwicket off the inside half.
on the pads to start, flicked through square leg for one
flight outside off, hit straight to cover
slow outside off, Rizwan defends. More pressure
runs down and plays the ball towards cover via his body
a fine paddle sweep down to fine leg for a couple
another fine sweep for a couple more in the same area. Much better from Rizwan
oh yea. Shot! In the slot for Wasim and boom. A nice clean swing from Wasim sends the ball straight over the bowler's head for six. Superlative timing.
145 kph, full and wide, left alone. Afforded him the luxury of that with the first ball
145 kph, pushed wider outside off, left alone
a top-edged pull down to fine leg for a run. Well-directed bouncer, on off, moving away
full and straight, pushed away to mid-on. Nice bowling
another dot. Just too many from Rizwan. Full on off, driven towards cover. Australia have bowled well to him
short and wide, scythed to deep point
defended off the front foot. Rizwan's strike rate is 50 after 40 balls
builds pressure on himself. Flat on leg, goes for a big sweep, a thick top edge lands safely in front of fine leg
pushed off the back foot to deep point. Wasim looking on point straightaway
should have been one there. Driven past cover and to mid-off, but they don't take the run
on the pads, off the pads for one to fine leg

And a wicket, immediately. Bangs it in. Rizwan has to pull from over his right shoulder, and he takes it on, ends up skewing it high, and Marsh, running to his left from deep midwicket, takes an excellent catch. He reaches overhead with both hands, first, then the ball bounces out, and he manages to catch it on the rebound, with his left hand, while tumbling to the floor
short, angling away from the left-hander, left alone
back of a length outside off, dabbed to backward point
length ball outside off, Imad pokes at it without really moving his feet, gets a thick edge down to the right of third man
back of a length on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
bouncer, Nawaz ducks under it
angled in from around the wicket, on middle stump on a good length, defended off the front foot
quicker now, on off stump, stays on the back foot to whip into the leg side
slower, more flight, slogs and inside-edges into his front pad
back of a length, goes with the angle towards middle stump. Makes room to stab towards point
in the blockhole, pitches outside leg. Looks to get his front foot out of the way and flick, can't connect
back of a length on the stumps, pushed gently into the off side for one
back of a length, angling into the left-hander and tucking him up for room. Gets up on his toes to defend
yorker, sweves in late and hits Nawaz on the foot as he looks to flick, possibly on the full too. Polite appeal from Starc, he knew that was missing leg stump
very full again, jabbed to short extra-cover
looks for the yorker again, slants it down the leg side this time
back of a length, tailing in late towards middle and leg. No room for Nawaz to work with, he just stands there and tucks it defensively into the leg side
bowled him! It was threatening to happen all through this over, and Starc finally gets one in the perfect spot. Full, swinging in, not a yorker, though. Nawaz slogs and misses, Starc hits off stump
full on off stump, clipped with the angle, wide of mid-on. Could have run three had he been able to. He's still got problems with his leg, however, so he only gets two
shortish outside off, makes some room to stab that to deep point
tossed up outside off, floated across the right-hander. Driven back to the bowler
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
down the track now, not quite to the pitch of the ball and has to hit squarer than he'd like. All along the ground to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, pokes to the left of point and Azhar, somehow, responds to his partner's call and gets to the striker's end

looks to sweep, and from the line of the stumps at that. Misses, and Wade's humongous appeal is turned down. Australia have used up their review; will be interesting to see that again. Did he get a bottom edge on it? Pitching on off, not turning enough to hit the stumps, according to Hawkeye
back of a length outside off, reaches out to punch to backward point
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
full again, a bit wider, Imad reaches out swishes his bat through it with an open face, manages to slice it to third man
back of a length outside off, beats Imad's angled-bat jab
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs it quietly to point
full-toss on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
tossed up on off stump, driven back to Head
quicker, flatter, back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to try and work it leg side, but he's hurried by the pace of it and can only do so defensively
fuller, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, jabbed into the cover point region
flat and full on middle and leg. Azhar closes his bat face too early while trying to flick, gets a leading edge back to the bowler, on the bounce, though
fired in on the pads, clipped to fine leg
slower short ball on off stump, Azhar waits on it and pulls to deep square leg
another slower short ball, Imad pulls to the right of long leg
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and slashes to deep point
short on off stump, pulled to long-on
short, angling away from off stump, cleverly played by Imad. Makes himself room and almost lets it pass him before slicing under it to stab it to the fine third-man boundary
down the track now. Marsh shortens his length and Imad pulls over the leaping fielder at midwicket
short outside off, Azhar dabs to short third man
back of a length, a bit of inward movement to cramp Azhar. He was looking to hit through the off side, and had to adjust and try to whip into the leg side. Inside-edges into his thigh pad
length ball on off stump. Azhar uses the angle to clip it to long-on, hitting uppishly for a moment but well to the left of the straight midwicket fielder

foxes him with the slower one immediately. Length ball outside off, and Imad is on the front foot, reaching for it. Checks himself, and ends up sending it ballooning softly into the air, to the right of cover. Somehow falls safely despite Maxwell's best efforts to chase it down
sees Azhar making room and bowls it shorter and at the body. Jabbed back to the bowler
cramps him again, but this time he works it off his body through backward square leg
short outside off, Azhar beats midwicket diving to his right with a topspin-smash pull

ooh. Wasim stepped away from the stumps at first, then went across them, in an effort to put the bowler off. He just bowls a regulation length ball, and Imad misses the attempted ramp over short fine leg. Ball bounces over the top of the stumps
gone. Slower short ball, and Imad can't get any real power on this pull. Hits it high, towards Warner, who runs in from the midwicket boundary to complete a simple catch
Now Azhar tries to step across and scoop over the keeper. Can't get bat to ball, and the ball bounces over off stump
short outside off, slapped away to the left of deep point
length ball slanted wide of off. Amir slogs and misses. Wanted to hammer that over mid-off, I guess
short, Faulkner's around-the-wicket angle cramps Azhar for room as he looks to hit through the off side. Ends up slapping it into the covers without really freeing his arms
slower length ball wide of off, sliced in the air, on the bounce, to the left of deep point
fullish on off stump, flat-batted to long-off
slower ball, full outside off, now it's Amir's turn to flat-bat to long-off
dropped. Full on off and middle. Azhar looks to whack it down the ground again, and hits it hard, back to the bowler, who gets his hands to it to his right but can't hold on

and he goes next ball. Looks to manufacture a shot off a length ball angling into him. Wants to hit that over short leg, I guess, but it's the slower ball, and he's through his shot too early and hits it down the throat of Warner running in from deep square leg
full on off stump, driven into the covers
back of a length, offcutter. Looks to make room and steer to third man, can't put bat to ball. Just bounces over the bails
fuller now, on off stump, scoops it in the air and lands the ball in the centre of the ever-shrinking triangle formed by long-off, extra-cover, and sweeper cover
in the blockhole now, jabbed back to the bowler
full on middle stump. Makes room and flat-bats to long-off
yorker on middle stump. Wahab does well to dig it out, inside-edges into his pad
slower ball, shortish outside off. No pace on it at all. Amir wanted to flat-bat through point, only manages to chop it into the ground and send it rolling into the covers
interesting shot. Slower ball, full, on off stump, and he gets down on his knee and sweeps to long-on
full and wide, another slower ball. Amir slices underneath the ball again and sends it looping over point

another slower ball, another swipe from Amir, wanting to hit over the covers. He manages to hit it in the intended direction, but without the intended power, and extra-cover takes a couple of steps back and lets the ball fall into his cupped hands

Wahab's on strike, though. Faulkner continues from over the wicket, slants a slower ball across him. Looks to drive it over extra-cover, doesn't get any power on it, and it just eludes the fingertips of the leaping, backtracking Smith
another slower ball, worked into the leg side
yorker, angling down leg. Wahab looks to get his feet out of the way and flick, but can't put bat to ball
low full-toss on middle stump, swiped to long-on
slower ball, fairly full and straight, clipped with the angle through midwicket

length ball, slower ball, wide of off stump. Wahab slogs, he has to. Wants to hit over mid-off, but again, can't get any power into it. Mid-off moves a few steps to his left and backwards, and takes a comfortable catch to wrap up a 92-run win
